comment.author: 99002941@N08
comment._content: Taken by a man called Richard Gibson who worked at the time for Francis Guy & Co. Cork. Date: 20th/ 21st January 1887. Some of these photos found their way into the halls of Westminster where they were displayed the following month.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/99002941@N08] Thank you, and I've replaced with a better resolution image. How do you know the photographer and date (brilliantly specific, thank you)?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 99002941@N08
comment._content: The Leeds Mercury for 21st (or 22nd, can't recall, sorry) stated Gibson was present for Guy & Co. for the past few days. An account of his trip, along with several M.P.s, to Coomasaharn also appeared in the Freeman's Journal. Gibson later ran the Limerick branch of Guy & Co.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/99002941@N08] Thank you very much - that's perfect!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
